info.title: Web Forms API version 1.1
info.description: The Web Forms API facilitates generating semantic HTML forms around everyday contracts.

get.summary: Returns a list of web form configurations.
get.description:
<ds-inlinemessage>The Web Forms API is available in all developer accounts, but only in certain production account plans. Contact 
[Docusign Support](https://support.docusign.com/s/?language=en_US) or your account manager to find out whether the Web Forms API is available for your production account plan.</ds-inlinemessage>

This method returns a list of web form configurations for a given account. Use the query parameters to sort and filter the response.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/web-forms-api/plan-integration/authentication/): `webforms_read`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account to which the web form belongs.

parameters.name: user_filter
parameters.description: Set to `owned_by_me` to return only forms owned by the authenticated user. By default, all forms are returned.

parameters.name: is_standalone
parameters.description: Set to `true` or `false` to filter by whether forms are [stand-alone (not tied to a template)](https://support.docusign.com/s/document-item?bundleId=yff1696971835267&topicId=gua1698120920620.html). By default, all forms are returned.

parameters.name: is_published
parameters.description: When `true`, only published forms are returned. By default, published and unpublished forms are both returned.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Sorts the results. You can sort by the time that the web forms were created or last modified, in descending or ascending order. Valid values:

* `lastModifiedDateTime:desc` (default)
* `lastModifiedDateTime:asc`
* `createdDateTime:desc`
* `createdDateTime:asc`

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: When set, filters results by whether each web form configuration contains the given text in its `formProperties.name` property.

parameters.name: start_position
parameters.description:
The zero-based index of the result from which to start returning results.

Use with `count` to limit the number of results.

The default value is 0.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description:
The maximum number of results to return.

Use `start_position` to specify the number of results to skip.

200.description: A list of forms assigned to the account

401.description: The authentication information is either missing or invalid

404.description: The requested resource was not found

get.description:
<ds-inlinemessage>The Web Forms API is available in all developer accounts, but only in certain production account plans. Contact 
[Docusign Support](https://support.docusign.com/s/?language=en_US) or your account manager to find out whether the Web Forms API is available for your production account plan.</ds-inlinemessage>

Retrieves a web form configuration.

If you make changes to an active form configuration, the unchanged active version will also be maintained. The two versions will have the same `formId` but different `formState` values. Use the `state` query parameter to indicate which version to return.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/web-forms-api/plan-integration/authentication/): `webforms_read`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account to which the web form belongs.

parameters.name: formId
parameters.description: The ID of the web form configuration.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description:
The state of the web form configuration. Valid values:

- `active`
- `draft`

200.description: Web Form that represents a single active version with metadata

401.description: The authentication information is either missing or invalid

404.description: The requested resource was not found

get.summary: Lists the instances of a given web form configuration.
get.description:
<ds-inlinemessage>The Web Forms API is available in all developer accounts, but only in certain production account plans. Contact 
[Docusign Support](https://support.docusign.com/s/?language=en_US) or your account manager to find out whether the Web Forms API is available for your production account plan.</ds-inlinemessage>

Retrieves all the instances of a given web form configuration.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/web-forms-api/plan-integration/authentication/): `webforms_instance_read`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account to which the web form belongs.

parameters.name: formId
parameters.description: The ID of the form configuration.

parameters.name: client_user_id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for a user from the client's system. This value can be anything your backend system would use to track individual form instances, such as employee IDs, email addresses, or surrogate key values.

200.description: List of all Web Form Instances with associated metadata.

401.description: The authentication information is either missing or invalid

404.description: The requested resource is not found

500.description: The service encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

post.description:
<ds-inlinemessage>The Web Forms API is available in all developer accounts, but only in certain production account plans. Contact 
[Docusign Support](https://support.docusign.com/s/?language=en_US) or your account manager to find out whether the Web Forms API is available for your production account plan.</ds-inlinemessage>

Creates an instance of a web form.

This endpoint returns a `formUrl` and `instanceToken` that you combine to obtain a secure URL. Use this URL to render the web form instance in your application.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/web-forms-api/plan-integration/authentication/): `webforms_instance_write`.


### Related topics

- [How to create and embed a web form instance](/docs/web-forms-api/how-to/create-embed-web-form-instance/)

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account to which the web form belongs.

parameters.name: formId
parameters.description: The ID of the web form configuration.

400.description: The form instance cannot be created, possibly due to validation failure.

401.description: The authentication information is either missing or invalid

404.description: The requested resource is not found

500.description: The service encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

get.summary: Creates a secure web form instance.
get.description:
<ds-inlinemessage>The Web Forms API is available in all developer accounts, but only in certain production account plans. Contact 
[Docusign Support](https://support.docusign.com/s/?language=en_US) or your account manager to find out whether the Web Forms API is available for your production account plan.</ds-inlinemessage>

Gets an instance of a web form specified by the configuration and instance IDs. To get all instances associated with a given configuration, use the [listInstances endpoint](/docs/web-forms-api/reference/webforms/instances/listinstances/).

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/web-forms-api/plan-integration/authentication/): `webforms_instance_read`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account to which the web form belongs.

parameters.name: formId
parameters.description: The ID of the web form configuration.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: The ID of the form instance.

401.description: The authentication information is either missing or invalid

404.description: The requested resource is not found

500.description: The service encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

post.description:
<ds-inlinemessage>The Web Forms API is available in all developer accounts, but only in certain production account plans. Contact 
[Docusign Support](https://support.docusign.com/s/?language=en_US) or your account manager to find out whether the Web Forms API is available for your production account plan.</ds-inlinemessage>

Generates a new instance token for an existing web form instance. Tokens expire after five minutes.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/web-forms-api/plan-integration/authentication/): `webforms_instance_write`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account to which the web form belongs.

parameters.name: formId
parameters.description: The ID of the web form configuration.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: The ID of the form instance.

200.description: Web Form Instance with new instance token and metadata

400.description: The instance token cannot be created, possibly because the validation failed.

401.description: The authentication information is either missing or invalid

404.description: The requested resource is not found

500.description: The service encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

scopes.webforms_instance_write: Create instance and modify instance configuration

AccountId.description: Account identifier in which the webform resides
AccountId.x-ms-summary: Account identifier in which the webform resides

WebFormId.description: Unique identifier for a webform entity that is consistent for it's lifetime
WebFormId.x-ms-summary: Unique identifier for a webform entity that is consistent for it's lifetime

InstanceId.description: Unique identifier for a webform instance that is consistent until its expiration
InstanceId.x-ms-summary: Unique identifier for a webform instance that is consistent until its expiration

ExpirationDateTime.description: The DateTime after which the webform instance is inaccessible.
ExpirationDateTime.x-ms-summary: The DateTime after which the webform instance is inaccessible.

CreatedDateTime.description: The DateTime when the webform instance is created.
CreatedDateTime.x-ms-summary: The DateTime when the webform instance is created.

LastModifiedDateTime.description: The DateTime when the webform instance is last modified.
LastModifiedDateTime.x-ms-summary: The DateTime when the webform instance is last modified.

IsStandalone.description: Is the form a standalone form
IsStandalone.x-ms-summary: Is the form a standalone form

InstanceToken.description: Unique token associated with an instance that is required to render the form instance. This token is valid for 5 minutes after which it needs to be refreshed using refreshToken api
InstanceToken.x-ms-summary: Unique token associated with an instance that is required to render the form instance. This token is valid for 5 minutes after which it needs to be refreshed using refreshToken api

TokenExpirationDateTime.description: The DateTime after which the token is expired and form instance is inaccessible.
TokenExpirationDateTime.x-ms-summary: The DateTime after which the token is expired and form instance is inaccessible.

FormUrl.description: The instance url which can be rendered by the user
FormUrl.x-ms-summary: The instance url which can be rendered by the user

InstanceStatus.description: The status of the form instance
InstanceStatus.x-ms-summary: The status of the form instance

InstanceSource.description: The method by which the form instance is created.
InstanceSource.x-ms-summary: The method by which the form instance is created.

ClientUserId.description: A unique identifier for a user that should originate from client's system. This value can be anything your backend system would use to track individual form instances. Examples include employee IDs, email addresses, surrogate key values, etc.
ClientUserId.x-ms-summary: A unique identifier for a user that should originate from client's system. This value can be anything your backend system would use to track individual form instances. Examples include employee IDs, email addresses, surrogate key values, etc.

AuthenticationInstant.description: A sender-generated value that indicates the date and time that the signer was authenticated.
AuthenticationInstant.x-ms-summary: A sender-generated value that indicates the date and time that the signer was authenticated.

AuthenticationMethod.description: A value that most closely matches the technique your application used to authenticate the recipient / signer.
AuthenticationMethod.x-ms-summary: A value that most closely matches the technique your application used to authenticate the recipient / signer.

AssertionId.description: A unique identifier of the authentication event executed by the client application.
AssertionId.x-ms-summary: A unique identifier of the authentication event executed by the client application.

SecurityDomain.description: The domain in which the user authenticated.
SecurityDomain.x-ms-summary: The domain in which the user authenticated.

ReturnUrl.description: The url to which the user is redirected after the signing is completed
ReturnUrl.x-ms-summary: The url to which the user is redirected after the signing is completed

ExpirationOffset.description: Specify the number of hours after which the form instance expires. For example, if the form expiration is set to 5 days, you should specify 120. The default value is 720 hours (30 days).
ExpirationOffset.x-ms-summary: Specify the number of hours after which the form instance expires. For example, if the form expiration is set to 5 days, you should specify 120. The default value is 720 hours (30 days).

WebFormUserInfo.description: A DocuSign user within the account associated with the form.

userId.description: The ID of the Docusign user.

userName.description: The user's name that will be displayed in the UI. The maximum length is 150 characters.

WebFormUserInfo.x-ms-summary: A DocuSign user within the account associated with the form.

WebFormSource.description: The source from which the webform is created.
WebFormSource.x-ms-summary: The source from which the webform is created.

WebFormType.description: Indicates whether the web form is standalone or attached to an eSignature template.
WebFormType.x-ms-summary: Indicates whether the web form is standalone or attached to an eSignature template.

CreateInstanceRequestBody.description: The request body for the `Instances::createInstance` endpoint.

formValues.description:
Key-value pairs used to prefill fields in the web form instance. The keys correspond to the values of the `publishedComponentNames` object on the `WebForm` (configuration) object.

For keys of type TextBox, Email, Date, Select, and RadioButtonGroup, the value should be a string. For keys of type Number, the value should be a number. For keys of type of CheckboxGroup, the value should be an array of strings.

For example, a web form configuration might have the following properties indicated by the `publishedComponentNames` object:
```
"publishedComponentNames": {
    "Signer_name": "TextBox",
    "Signer_email": "Email",
    "Dropdown": "Select",
    "Hobbies": "CheckboxGroup"
}
```

Then, this property might be:
```
{
    "Signer_name": "Francis Beagle",
    "Signer_email": "francis@example.com",
    "Hobbies": ["walking", "napping"]
}
```

Note that you do not have to include values for every component. This property is **optional.**

clientUserId.description:
A unique identifier for a user from the client's system. This value can be anything your backend system would use to track individual web form instances, such as employee IDs, email addresses, or surrogate key values.

This property is **required.** The maximum length is 100 characters.

authenticationInstant.description:
Set this value to indicate the date and time that the signer was authenticated.

This property is **optional.** If it is provided, the value will be included in the corresponding envelopes' certificates of completion.

authenticationMethod.description:
Set this value to indicate the technique your application used to authenticate the user.

This property is **optional.** The maximum length is 40 characters. If it is provided, this property will be included in the corresponding envelopes' certificates of completion.

assertionId.description:
Set this value to identify the authentication event executed by your application.

This property is **optional.** If it is provided, this property will be included in the corresponding envelopes' certificates of completion.

securityDomain.description:
Set this value to indicate the domain in which the user authenticated.

This property is **optional.** If it is provided, this property will be included in the corresponding envelopes' certificates of completion.

returnUrl.description: The URL to which the user is redirected after the signing is completed. This property is **optional.**

expirationOffset.description:
The number of hours after which the web form instance expires. For example, if you want the instance to expire after 5 days, set this property to `120`.

This property is **optional.** The default value is `720` (30 days).

tags.description:
Set this metadata to help your application identify the web form instance. The default value is `[]`. 

Example value: `["Client A", "Agreement Category B"]`

This property is **optional.**

CreateInstanceRequestBody.x-ms-summary: The request body for the `Instances::createInstance` endpoint.

WebFormInstanceMetadata.description: Metadata associated with the web form instance.

expirationDateTime.description: The DateTime after which the web form instance will be inaccessible.

createdDateTime.description: The DateTime at which the web form instance was created.

createdBy.description: The user that created the web form instance.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The DateTime at which the web form instance was last modified.

lastModifiedBy.description: The user who last modified the web form instance.

WebFormInstanceMetadata.x-ms-summary: Metadata associated with the web form instance.

WebFormInstanceList.description: A list of web form instance items.

items.description: Array of web form instance items.

WebFormInstanceList.x-ms-summary: A list of web form instance items.

WebFormInstance.description: An object that contains the instance url required to render the webform instance and its metadata such as created by, created time

formUrl.description: The base URL to render the web form instance. This value is the same for every instance created from the same configuration.

instanceToken.description:
The instance token for the web form instance. To obtain the secure URL for your web form instance, append this value to the `formUrl` value in the following format:
`https://[formUrl]#instanceToken=[instanceToken]`

The token expires after five minutes. To get a new token, call the [refreshToken](/docs/webforms-api/reference/webforms/instances/refreshtoken/) endpoint.

tokenExpirationDateTime.description: The DateTime after which the token expires.

id.description: The unique ID of the web form instance.

formId.description: The ID of the form configuration from which the form instance was created.

clientUserId.description: A unique identifier for a user from the client's system.

tags.description:
Metadata to help your application identify the web form instance.

Example: `["Client A", "Agreement Category B"]`

status.description:
The status of the web form instance. Valid values:

* `INITIATED`: The web form instance is accessible and can be opened until it is submitted or expires.
* `SUBMITTED`: The instance has been submitted and cannot be opened again.
* `INPROGRESS`: The user has saved their progress, but has not yet submitted the form instance.
* `EXPIRED`: The instance has expired.
* `FAILED`: The instance has failed.

envelopes.description: The associated envelope that is created when the instance is submitted

createdDateTime.description: The dateTime when an envelope is created.

instanceMetadata.description: Metadata associated with the web form instance.

formValues.description:
Key-value pairs that represent the current values of the fields in the web form instance. The keys correspond to the `componentName` values of the `formContent.components` object on the `WebForm` (configuration) object. See [Form field definitions](/docs/web-forms-api/plan-integration/retrieve-configuration-details/#form-field-definitions) for more information.

See [Request that retrieves web form instance values](/docs/web-forms-api/plan-integration/retrieve-submitted-values/#request-that-retrieves-web-form-instance-values) for an example of a `formValues` object returned by this request.

WebFormInstance.x-ms-summary: An object that contains the instance url required to render the webform instance and its metadata such as created by, created time

WebFormSummaryList.description: A list of zero or more paginated web form summary items.

items.description: A list of objects describing individual web form configurations.

resultSetSize.description: The number of web form configurations returned for the current page.

totalSetSize.description: The total number of web form configurations.

startPosition.description: The starting index position of the current result set.

endPosition.description: The last index position in the result set.

nextUrl.description: The URI for the next chunk of web form configurations. It is an empty string if this is the last set of results.

previousUrl.description: The URI for the previous chunk of web form configurations. It is an empty string if this is the first set of results.

WebFormSummaryList.x-ms-summary: A list of zero or more paginated web form summary items.

WebFormSummary.description: An object summarizing a web form configuration.

id.description: The ID of the web form.

accountId.description: The ID of the account to which the web form belongs.

isPublished.description: Whether the form is published (`true` or `false`).

isEnabled.description: When `true`, the web form configuration is activated. You can only create web form instances from enabled web forms.

isUploaded.description: Indicates whether the form was created through an upload.

hasDraftChanges.description: When `true`, the web form configuration has changes that are not yet published.

formState.description:
The state of the web form configuration. Valid values:

* `active`
* `draft`

formProperties.description: Properties of the web form configuration that are consistent across versions.

formMetadata.description: Metadata for the web form configuration.

WebFormSummary.x-ms-summary: An object summarizing a web form configuration.

WebFormValues.description: Key-value pairs of data used to create a form instance.
WebFormValues.x-ms-summary: Key-value pairs of data used to create a form instance.

WebFormState.description: The state of the form content
WebFormState.x-ms-summary: The state of the form content

WebFormVersionId.description: Identifier for the version that can be used for display and retrieval in the API
WebFormVersionId.x-ms-summary: Identifier for the version that can be used for display and retrieval in the API

WebFormProperties.description: Properties of the web form configuration that are consistent across versions.

name.description: The name of the web form. The maximum length is 150 characters.

isPrivateAccess.description: When `true`, a valid instance token is required to access the instance via its URL.

WebFormProperties.x-ms-summary: Properties of the web form configuration that are consistent across versions.

WebFormName.description: User friendly Form name. This can be set via UI and/or API.
WebFormName.x-ms-summary: User friendly Form name. This can be set via UI and/or API.

IsPrivateAccess.description: When a form is private, the Player will not be accessible via its URL unless a valid instance token is provided
IsPrivateAccess.x-ms-summary: When a form is private, the Player will not be accessible via its URL unless a valid instance token is provided

WebFormComponentType.description: Type of components used in the web form
WebFormComponentType.x-ms-summary: Type of components used in the web form

WebFormContent.description: Container for the components map and future form data

additionalProperties.description: Each component type contains additional properties

componentKey.description: The unique key of the component

componentType.description: The type of component this object represents

componentName.description: Name value that is used for mapping components to external sources

isStandalone.description: When `true`, the form is [stand-alone (not tied to a template)](https://support.docusign.com/s/document-item?bundleId=yff1696971835267&topicId=gua1698120920620.html).

brandId.description: The ID of the brand associated with the web form configuration.

templates.description: Information about the template used to create the web form configuration. If the web form is stand-alone, this property is an empty array.

WebFormContent.x-ms-summary: Container for the components map and future form data

TemplateProperties.description: Information about the template used to create the web form configuration.

originalTemplateId.description: The ID of the original template used to create the web form configuration.

clonedTemplateId.description: The ID of the cloned template used to create the web form configuration. The original template is cloned when the web form is created, so any future modifications do not affect the web form.

importedDateTime.description: The DateTime at which the template information was assigned to the web form configuration.

recipientIds.description:
An array of recipient IDs mapped by the template.

Example: `["12345678", "23456789"]`

TemplateProperties.x-ms-summary: Information about the template used to create the web form configuration.

source.description:
The source from which the web form was created. Valid values:
- `templates`: Created from an eSignature template.
- `blank`: Created as a standalone web form.
- `form`: Created as a copy of an existing web form.

type.description:
Indicates whether the web form is standalone or attached to an eSignature template.
Valid values:
- `standalone`: Not associated with an eSignature template.
- `hasEsignTemplate`: Associated with an eSignature template.

sourceFormId.description: The ID of the web form from which this web form was copied.

owner.description: The owner of the web form configuration. This can be the creator of the web form or another user who has received transferred ownership.

sender.description: The eSignature sender who authorizes the web form. You can [change the sender via the UI](https://support.docusign.com/s/document-item?language=en_US&bundleId=gmi1660583110357&topicId=ngb1680555719338.html).

lastModifiedBy.description: The user who last modified the web form.

formContentModifiedBy.description: The user that last modified the form content.

formPropertiesModifiedBy.description: The user that last modified the form properties.

lastPublishedBy.description: The user who last published a draft of the web form.

lastEnabledBy.description: The user who last enabled the web form.

lastDisabledBy.description: The user who last unpublished the web form.

archivedDateTime.description: The UTC DateTime when the web form was last archived.

createdDateTime.description: The UTC DateTime when the web form was created.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The UTC DateTime when the web form was last modified.

formContentModifiedDateTime.description: The UTC DateTime when the web form content was last modified.

formPropertiesModifiedDateTime.description: The UTC DateTime when the web form properties were last changed.

lastPublishedDateTime.description: The UTC DateTime when a draft version was last published to active.

lastEnabledDateTime.description: The UTC DateTime when the form was last enabled.

lastDisabledDateTime.description: The UTC DateTime when the form was last disabled.

lastSenderConsentDateTime.description: The most recent UTC DateTime that a user added their consent to [become a sender](https://support.docusign.com/s/document-item?language=en_US&bundleId=gmi1660583110357&topicId=ngb1680555719338.html) for the form.

publishedSlug.description: A string that identifies the web form when made public. This value is consistent throughout the lifetime of the web form.

publishedComponentNames.description: Dictionary containing mapping of componentName to ADM type for all the published components

HttpSuccess.description: A simple response indicating success when no extra data is needed
HttpSuccess.x-ms-summary: A simple response indicating success when no extra data is needed

HttpError.description: An error occurred processing a request.

errorCode.description:
A code indicating what error occurred. Possible values:

* 400: Bad request
* 401: Authentication information is missing or invalid
* 403: Requestor not authorized
* 404: Resource not found
* 500: Internal server error
* 503: Service is temporarily unavailable

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

HttpError.x-ms-summary: An error occurred processing a request.

Instances.x-ms-summary: Methods to create and get secure instances of a web form.

tags.name: Instances
tags.description:
<ds-inlinemessage>The Web Forms API is available in all developer accounts, but only in certain production account plans. Contact 
[Docusign Support](https://support.docusign.com/s/?language=en_US) or your account manager to find out whether the Web Forms API is available for your production account plan.</ds-inlinemessage>

Methods to create and retrieve instances of a web form. Each instance is secure and unique to a user session.

tags.name: Configurations
tags.description:
<ds-inlinemessage>The Web Forms API is available in all developer accounts, but only in certain production account plans. Contact 
[Docusign Support](https://support.docusign.com/s/?language=en_US) or your account manager to find out whether the Web Forms API is available for your production account plan.</ds-inlinemessage>

A web form configuration is a definition that you can use to create many instances. To create a web form configuration, use the [Web Forms Builder](https://support.docusign.com/s/document-item?language=en_US&bundleId=gmi1660583110357&topicId=gpc1660591510274.html). These methods enable you to get data about one or multiple web form configurations.
